visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly rainfall patterns using two synthetic meteorological datasets with inverse seasonal trends

tooltip.formatter:
function () { return this.points.reduce(function (s, point) { return s + '
' + point.series.name + ': ' + Highcharts.numberFormat(point.y/100, 2) + 'm'; }, '' + this.x + ''); }

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two 12-dimensional time series representing monthly rainfall measurements. Categorical x-axis labels show months, while the numerical y-axis displays precipitation in centimeters converted to meters via tooltip formatting. Synthetic data follows realistic hydrological patterns: Series 1 mimics coastal climates with summer droughts (Jun-Sep μ=1.76m), while Series 2 reflects continental regions with winter precipitation peaks (Dec-Mar μ=2.16m). Values maintain ecological plausibility (0.29m-2.16m range) and inverse covariance structures (r=-0.89). The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines while maintaining perceptual discriminability through color (ΔE > 20) and dash styles. Cairo's principles are applied through proportional axis scaling and redundant temperature encoding (position + color). Statistical validity is ensured through constrained randomization (Box-Muller transform with μ±2σ bounds).
